headline: Crony Capitalism Is Coming to America
abstract: Business success may increasingly depend on connections, not competence.
lead_paragraph: It’s late 2025, and Donald Trump has done what he said he would do: impose high tariffs — taxes on imports — on goods coming from abroad, with extremely high tariffs on imports from China. These tariffs have had exactly the effect many economists predicted, although Trump insisted otherwise: higher prices for American buyers.
snippet: Business success may increasingly depend on connections, not competence.

headline: End of Trump Cases Leaves Limits on Presidential Criminality Unclear
abstract: Donald J. Trump is set to regain office without clarity on the scope of presidential immunity and with a lingering cloud over whether outside special counsels can investigate high-level wrongdoing.
lead_paragraph: The end of the two federal criminal cases against President-elect Donald J. Trump on Monday left momentous, unsettled questions about constraints on criminal wrongdoing by presidents, from the scope of presidential immunity to whether the Justice Department may continue to appoint outside special counsels to investigate high-level wrongdoing.
snippet: Donald J. Trump is set to regain office without clarity on the scope of presidential immunity and with a lingering cloud over whether outside special counsels can investigate high-level wrongdoing.

headline: Trump Plans Tariffs on Mexico, Canada and China That Could Cripple Trade
abstract: The president-elect said that he would impose the across-the-board tariffs on Day 1 and that they would stay in place until Canada, Mexico and China halted the flow of drugs and migrants.
lead_paragraph: Follow the latest updates on President-elect Trump’s transition.
snippet: The president-elect said that he would impose the across-the-board tariffs on Day 1 and that they would stay in place until Canada, Mexico and China halted the flow of drugs and migrants.

headline: At the Brooklyn Academy, Musical Journeys Through Minefields
abstract: The Silkroad Ensemble’s “American Railroad” and Alarm Will Sound’s “Sun Dogs” used music and images to engage with difficult topics.
lead_paragraph: The completion of the transcontinental railroad was a herculean achievement. In 1850, the United States had 10,000 miles of track; by 1900, trains carried people, goods and ideas from coast to coast over 215,000 miles of track. Recently, historians have begun to tally the human cost of this construction project, especially among the people who performed the dangerous and backbreaking labor and the Native tribes whose lands and livelihoods were slashed through by the tracks.
snippet: The Silkroad Ensemble’s “American Railroad” and Alarm Will Sound’s “Sun Dogs” used music and images to engage with difficult topics.

headline: There Is No Excuse for the Bullying of Sarah McBride
abstract: After a brutal election, Democrats need to get better at talking about trans issues.
lead_paragraph: It’s hard to imagine how terrifying it must be to be a trans person, or the parent of one, in America right now.
snippet: After a brutal election, Democrats need to get better at talking about trans issues.

headline: Trial of Controversial Alzheimer’s Drug Halted After Disappointing Results
abstract: Cassava Sciences said that its drug did not significantly reduce cognitive decline in 1,900 people with mild to moderate Alzheimer’s disease.
lead_paragraph: Cassava Sciences, a small biotechnology company based in Austin, Texas, announced it would stop the advanced clinical trial for an experimental Alzheimer’s drug, ending a long-contested bid for regulatory approval.
snippet: Cassava Sciences said that its drug did not significantly reduce cognitive decline in 1,900 people with mild to moderate Alzheimer’s disease.

headline: Corrections: Nov. 26, 2024
abstract: Corrections that appeared in print on Tuesday, Nov. 26, 2024.
lead_paragraph: An article on Saturday about the ruling junta in Mali replacing the country’s prime minister misstated the military rank of the new prime minister, Abdoulaye Maiga. He is a general, not a colonel.
snippet: Corrections that appeared in print on Tuesday, Nov. 26, 2024.

headline: Significant Stretches
abstract: Killian Olson makes his Crossword debut.
lead_paragraph: Jump to: Today’s Theme | Tricky Clues
snippet: Killian Olson makes his Crossword debut.

headline: Israeli Strikes Threaten Lebanon’s Archaeological Treasures
abstract: The country is home to thousands of years’ worth of antiquities. Some have already been damaged or destroyed in the war, alarming the conservationists trying to protect them.
lead_paragraph: For Mohammad Kanso, the ancient Roman temples of Baalbek felt like home.
snippet: The country is home to thousands of years’ worth of antiquities. Some have already been damaged or destroyed in the war, alarming the conservationists trying to protect them.

headline: Top Trump Aide Accused of Asking for Money to ‘Promote’ Potential Appointees
abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump ordered the investigation by his legal team into Boris Epshteyn, a powerful figure in the transition. Mr. Epshteyn denies the allegations.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s legal team found evidence that a top adviser asked for retainer fees from potential appointees in order to promote them for jobs in the new administration, five people briefed on the matter said on Monday.
snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump ordered the investigation by his legal team into Boris Epshteyn, a powerful figure in the transition. Mr. Epshteyn denies the allegations.

headline: Biden Administration to Lend $6 Billion for Rivian E.V. Factory
abstract: The financing for a factory in Georgia is part of a last-minute effort to establish climate policies before President-elect Donald J. Trump takes office.
lead_paragraph: The Biden administration said on Monday that it would lend $6 billion to help Rivian build an electric car factory in Georgia, part of an effort to lock in Democratic climate policies before President-elect Donald J. Trump takes office.
snippet: The financing for a factory in Georgia is part of a last-minute effort to establish climate policies before President-elect Donald J. Trump takes office.

headline: TikTok Influencer Arrested After Documenting Stolen Items, Police Say
abstract: Marlena Velez, 22, stole the items by scanning false bar codes in the self-checkout to make the items cheaper, the police said.
lead_paragraph: A Florida woman and TikTok influencer was arrested after she shoplifted about $500 worth of items from Target and posted about her shopping spree to her hundreds of thousands of social media followers, the authorities said.
snippet: Marlena Velez, 22, stole the items by scanning false bar codes in the self-checkout to make the items cheaper, the police said.

headline: Quote of the Day: PULLOUTS BY U.N. DISMAY HAITIANS
abstract: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, November 26, 2024
lead_paragraph: “What about the ones who can’t leave?”
snippet: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, November 26, 2024

headline: The World’s Pioneering Tech Cop Is Making Her Exit
abstract: Margrethe Vestager, the European Union’s antitrust regulator, who put technology’s harms on the global agenda, reflected on a decade of taking on the biggest companies and what comes next.
lead_paragraph: Margrethe Vestager, the European Union antitrust enforcer who has been the world’s foremost critic of the tech industry, recently walked through her Brussels office wondering what to do with the stuff she had accumulated during a decade in that role, which ends late this month. At one point, she paused to lift a sculpture of a hand holding up its middle finger.
snippet: Margrethe Vestager, the European Union’s antitrust regulator, who put technology’s harms on the global agenda, reflected on a decade of taking on the biggest companies and what comes next.

headline: China’s Police Are Preying on Small Firms in Search of Cash
abstract: With localities facing budget holes, the police are crossing provincial borders to collect fines and draining company treasuries. Businesses call it a shakedown.
lead_paragraph: In April 2023, police officers from a city in southern Guangdong Province traveled 600 miles north to Wuhan, detained 25 employees of a social media company and coerced its finance staff to transfer more than $41 million to accounts associated with the police.
snippet: With localities facing budget holes, the police are crossing provincial borders to collect fines and draining company treasuries. Businesses call it a shakedown.

headline: Angela Merkel Tells Us What She Really Thinks
abstract: In her memoir, the former German chancellor reflects on her political rise and defends her record as the outlook for her country turns grim.
lead_paragraph: “Never explain, never complain,” is a maxim supposedly espoused by the British royal family. As Angela Merkel writes in her exhaustive yet surprisingly fast-paced autobiography, “Freedom,” it also became a phrase that she would repeat to herself during her 16 years as German chancellor, from 2005 until she stepped down in December 2021.
snippet: In her memoir, the former German chancellor reflects on her political rise and defends her record as the outlook for her country turns grim.

headline: As Russia Advances in Ukraine, a Cop Has to Flee City After City
abstract: For Volodymyr Nikulin, being a wartime police officer means aiding evacuees, surviving a shrapnel wound and tackling looters. It also means quickly switching cities when one falls to the invaders.
lead_paragraph: The belongings of Volodymyr Nikulin, a Ukrainian police officer stationed near the country’s eastern front line, boil down to this: a shrapnel-riddled car, a small sack stuffed with sweaters and pants, and two plastic bags filled with basic food and medicine.
snippet: For Volodymyr Nikulin, being a wartime police officer means aiding evacuees, surviving a shrapnel wound and tackling looters. It also means quickly switching cities when one falls to the invaders.

headline: A Misstep by Ireland’s Prime Minister Muddies Election Race
abstract: A fumbled meeting with a voter may dent Simon Harris’s popularity. But his coalition government’s main opposition, the nationalist party Sinn Fein, will likely remain locked out of power.
lead_paragraph: For weeks, the Republic of Ireland looked like a rare Western democracy bent on defying the global trend of tossing out its government. The two centrist parties that have governed Ireland in a coalition since 2020, Fine Gael and Fianna Fáil, appeared to be on cruise control to lock up enough votes to stay in power.
snippet: A fumbled meeting with a voter may dent Simon Harris’s popularity. But his coalition government’s main opposition, the nationalist party Sinn Fein, will likely remain locked out of power.

headline: Tuesday Briefing
abstract: Talks on a truce between Israel and Lebanon.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel is set to meet with his cabinet today to discuss a proposed cease-fire with Hezbollah, Israeli officials said. U.S. officials have pressured him to finalize the terms this week, and Netanyahu has indicated that he’s open to a deal, according to other Israeli officials briefed on his thinking.
snippet: Talks on a truce between Israel and Lebanon.

headline: Rescuers Walk 14 Hours to Save Sole Survivor of Costa Rica Plane Crash
abstract: Rescue workers trekked overnight across a remote mountain forest carrying a woman who had survived a crash that killed five of the six people aboard.
lead_paragraph: Emergency workers in Costa Rica walked through a remote mountain forest on Tuesday carrying a woman who was in critical condition after she survived a plane crash that killed five of the six people aboard.
snippet: Rescue workers trekked overnight across a remote mountain forest carrying a woman who had survived a crash that killed five of the six people aboard.

headline: Mr. Trump, Do You Realize How Much the World Has Changed Since You Were President?
abstract: Three giant, shifting tectonic plates will have profound implications for the new administration.
lead_paragraph: Donald Trump left the White House nearly four years ago. Given his self-confidence, I suspect he is now thinking: “What could be so different? I’ve got this.”
snippet: Three giant, shifting tectonic plates will have profound implications for the new administration.

headline: She Was the Most Powerful Woman in the World. And She Isn’t Ready to Say Sorry.
abstract: In her memoir, Angela Merkel doesn’t take the chance to make amends.
lead_paragraph: On page 273 of her memoir, Angela Merkel admits she made a mistake.
snippet: In her memoir, Angela Merkel doesn’t take the chance to make amends.

headline: Late Night Makes Its Last Jokes About Biden Pardoning Turkeys
abstract: Although Thanksgiving was still three days away, “the turkeys looked at Biden and said, ‘We better get this done,’” Jimmy Fallon said.
lead_paragraph: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night’s highlights that lets you sleep — and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.
snippet: Although Thanksgiving was still three days away, “the turkeys looked at Biden and said, ‘We better get this done,’” Jimmy Fallon said.

headline: Word of the Day: propaganda
abstract: This word has appeared in 678 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
lead_paragraph: The word propaganda has appeared in 678 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Oct. 29 in “How Russia, China and Iran Are Interfering in the Presidential Election” by Sheera Frenkel, Tiffany Hsu and Steven Lee Myers:
snippet: This word has appeared in 678 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?

headline: Rocket Engine Fire Stalls Japan’s Ambitions to Launch Satellites
abstract: Japan is off to a shaky start in its efforts to break into the space rocket market dominated by Elon Musk’s SpaceX.
lead_paragraph: Japan halted an engine test for one of its flagship rockets after a fire broke out at the launch site on Tuesday, marking the latest setback in the country’s efforts to establish a foothold in the growing market for vehicles capable of launching satellites into orbit.
snippet: Japan is off to a shaky start in its efforts to break into the space rocket market dominated by Elon Musk’s SpaceX.

headline: Fire Engulfs Japan Rocket Test Site
abstract: Large plumes of smoke billowed from the launch site at Tanegashima Space Center, Japan, after a malfunction during an engine test.
lead_paragraph: Large plumes of smoke billowed from the launch site at Tanegashima Space Center, Japan, after a malfunction during an engine test.
snippet: Large plumes of smoke billowed from the launch site at Tanegashima Space Center, Japan, after a malfunction during an engine test.

headline: He Was One of New York’s Busiest Shoplifters. His Mother Was a Cop.
abstract: Drug addiction fueled David Andino’s need to steal. Every day, he hit the same Target in Manhattan. His mother, a retired police officer, hadn’t seen him in years.
lead_paragraph: The shoplifter knew the geography of the big gleaming Target store in TriBeCa as well as he knew his dingy little $20-a-week room uptown.
snippet: Drug addiction fueled David Andino’s need to steal. Every day, he hit the same Target in Manhattan. His mother, a retired police officer, hadn’t seen him in years.

headline: On the Wings of War
abstract: Scientists study the flight of hummingbirds to design robots for drone warfare.
lead_paragraph: Hummingbirds zooming around the garden from flower to flower and sipping nectar probably don’t appear at first glance to be models for instruments of war.
snippet: Scientists study the flight of hummingbirds to design robots for drone warfare.

headline: Spelling Bee Forum
abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.
lead_paragraph: Hi, busy bees! Welcome to today’s Spelling Bee forum. Enter the comments section to see hints, conversation, helpful tips and creative content from other solvers.
snippet: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

headline: How to Watch the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade
abstract: For the 98th time, Macy’s brings New Yorkers its annual parade. This year, there will be 22 floats, 17 character balloons and performances by the Temptations and T-Pain.
lead_paragraph: A flying turkey, loads of confetti and dazzling dancers. It’s time to kick off the holidays in New York City.
snippet: For the 98th time, Macy’s brings New Yorkers its annual parade. This year, there will be 22 floats, 17 character balloons and performances by the Temptations and T-Pain.

headline: 5 Ways to Fix New York City’s Housing Crisis
abstract: Here is what renters, landlords, developers and politicians say.
lead_paragraph: This is The Housing Crunch, a five-part series on New York City’s affordable housing crisis.
snippet: Here is what renters, landlords, developers and politicians say.

headline: They Attended Trump’s Trial. Now He’s Offering Them High-Profile Jobs.
abstract: A parade of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s allies showed their loyalty at his criminal trial in Manhattan. Many are now in line for key government jobs.
lead_paragraph: On a sunny spring day this year, two members of Congress and two former presidential candidates stepped out of the Manhattan courthouse where Donald J. Trump was being tried on criminal charges.
snippet: A parade of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s allies showed their loyalty at his criminal trial in Manhattan. Many are now in line for key government jobs.

headline: ‘Glicked’
abstract: Can “Wicked” and “Gladiator II” recapture the magic of “Barbenheimer”?
lead_paragraph: “Wicked” and “Gladiator II” both opened on Friday. With its own catchy portmanteau, “Glicked,” some fans are trying to recapture the excitement from the movie event of last summer: the same-day opening of “Barbie” and “Oppenheimer,” or “Barbenheimer.”
snippet: Can “Wicked” and “Gladiator II” recapture the magic of “Barbenheimer”?

headline: Their Landlord Overcharged Them. Now Tenants Will Split $15 Million.
abstract: Dozens of New York City renters are receiving payoffs from Blackstone in a settlement of a case that accused the previous landlord of violating rent-stabilization rules.
lead_paragraph: The private equity firm Blackstone is paying some New York City renters more than $100,000 each to resolve claims that they had been overcharged for their rent-stabilized apartments, according to court papers and an announcement from a housing watchdog group on Tuesday.
snippet: Dozens of New York City renters are receiving payoffs from Blackstone in a settlement of a case that accused the previous landlord of violating rent-stabilization rules.

headline: Pakistan Deploys Army in Its Capital as Protesters and Police Clash
abstract: Soldiers were ordered to defend government buildings with gunfire if needed, as supporters of former Prime Minister Imran Khan demanded his release from prison.
lead_paragraph: Pakistan deployed its army in the nation’s capital on Tuesday with orders to shoot protesters if necessary, as deadly clashes escalated between the police and supporters of former Prime Minister Imran Khan.
snippet: Soldiers were ordered to defend government buildings with gunfire if needed, as supporters of former Prime Minister Imran Khan demanded his release from prison.

headline: China’s Huawei Takes Aim at Apple With Latest Smartphone
abstract: Last year, a chip breakthrough put Huawei on top of the Chinese smartphone market. Now it is rolling out its newest phone, the Mate 70 series.
lead_paragraph: Last year, the tech giant Huawei catapulted to the top of the smartphone market in China when it released the Mate 60 Pro, a phone that contained a tiny computer chip more advanced than any previously made by a Chinese company.
snippet: Last year, a chip breakthrough put Huawei on top of the Chinese smartphone market. Now it is rolling out its newest phone, the Mate 70 series.

headline: Hong Kong’s Top Court Upholds Rights of Same-Sex Married Couples
abstract: Long-running legal battles culminated in a ruling that preserves public housing benefits and inheritance rights in the territory.
lead_paragraph: Hong Kong’s top court ruled on Tuesday to uphold inheritance and public housing benefits for same-sex married couples, a decision that supporters hailed as an important step toward expanding gay rights in the territory.
snippet: Long-running legal battles culminated in a ruling that preserves public housing benefits and inheritance rights in the territory.

headline: Is Creativity Dead?
abstract: Or is the algorithm just hiding it from you?
lead_paragraph: Or is the algorithm just hiding it from you?
snippet: Or is the algorithm just hiding it from you?

headline: The Future Is Eerie in This Queens Townhouse
abstract: Two designers created a unique home that they hope makes visitors feel like they’re in an alternate world.
lead_paragraph: When Erica Sellers bought a townhouse in Ridgewood, Queens, with plans to renovate it, she simply wanted to build a new home for herself. But after she invited her friend Jeremy Silberberg to see it, the project grew into something much more ambitious.
snippet: Two designers created a unique home that they hope makes visitors feel like they’re in an alternate world.

headline: This Drinking Habit Is More Dangerous Than Bingeing
abstract: And it’s on the rise among middle-aged drinkers.
lead_paragraph: The holidays offer an excuse to gather with loved ones, let loose and indulge: Plates loaded with comfort foods. Unapologetic napping. All the pie.
snippet: And it’s on the rise among middle-aged drinkers.

headline: Colombia and Venezuela Have a Beef: Who Owns the, or Makes the Best, Arepa?
abstract: Both countries claim the cornbread as their own. But where does it really come from? And who makes it better?
lead_paragraph: A heated and longstanding rivalry simmers between neighbors Colombia and Venezuela — not over politics, migration or even soccer, but over the humble arepa.
snippet: Both countries claim the cornbread as their own. But where does it really come from? And who makes it better?

headline: Taxing Farm Animals’ Farts and Burps? Denmark Gives It a Try.
abstract: Cows and pigs produce a large share of planet-warming methane. A new tax is part of a plan to clean that up.
lead_paragraph: Denmark, known for its inventive restaurants and elegant design studios, is about to become known for something more basic: the world’s first belch and manure tax.
snippet: Cows and pigs produce a large share of planet-warming methane. A new tax is part of a plan to clean that up.

headline: ‘Wicked’ and the Merchandising Juggernaut That Eclipses ‘Barbie’
abstract: The new movie’s tie-ins are the logical endpoint for a Broadway show that always intended to be huge.
lead_paragraph: It started with the dolls.
snippet: The new movie’s tie-ins are the logical endpoint for a Broadway show that always intended to be huge.

headline: Big, Bold ’80s-Esque Jewelry Is Back
abstract: The season’s most precious accessories come in bright colors, with plenty of sparkle and an abundance of gold.
snippet: The season’s most precious accessories come in bright colors, with plenty of sparkle and an abundance of gold.

headline: Emma Corrin and Maggie Nelson on the Strength in Vulnerability
abstract: The “Nosferatu” actor and the writer discuss solitude, self-editing and the playfulness of their work.
lead_paragraph: Emma Corrin first encountered Maggie Nelson’s work three summers ago, when the actor was in Brighton, England, filming 2022’s “My Policeman,” a British drama about postwar sexual repression. At the time, Corrin, now 28, was grappling with their gender identity, and a friend recommended “The Argonauts” (2015), Nelson’s memoir about queer desire and making a family with her partner, the artist Harry Dodge. The book appealed so deeply to Corrin that, when that production ended, they decided to remain at the flat they’d rented during filming to finish reading it.
snippet: The “Nosferatu” actor and the writer discuss solitude, self-editing and the playfulness of their work.

headline: For These TikTok Dramas, It Is All About the Storytelling
abstract: Short-form series like “Bistro Huddy” and Paloma Diamond bring old-fashioned serials to the world of social media.
lead_paragraph: The most popular dish on the menu at Bistro Huddy is the Santa Fe Chicken. Unfortunately, you can’t order it, no matter how often the restaurant’s regular customers do. That’s because the brick-walled bistro isn’t a restaurant at all. Rather, it’s a green screen set up in the Los Angeles home of Drew Talbert and his wife, Andrea Kelley.
snippet: Short-form series like “Bistro Huddy” and Paloma Diamond bring old-fashioned serials to the world of social media.

headline: The Air in Subway Stations Is Bad for You, Study Finds
abstract: An N.Y.U. researcher found that the No. 1 stations in Washington Heights are especially unhealthy. The M.T.A. doesn’t agree.
lead_paragraph: Good morning. It’s Tuesday. Today we’ll look at a study that said air quality in subway stations is poor. And, with the migrant crisis easing, we’ll look at what President-elect Donald Trump’s threats to deport undocumented immigrants might mean for the city.
snippet: An N.Y.U. researcher found that the No. 1 stations in Washington Heights are especially unhealthy. The M.T.A. doesn’t agree.

headline: $29 Flights, Half-Price Cruises: Whether It’s Black Friday or Travel Tuesday, Deals Abound
abstract: Our Frugal Traveler columnist waded through the sales, and found some of the best bargains she’s seen in years.
lead_paragraph: As a sales season, Black Friday long ago turned the weekend corner to extend to Cyber Monday. And it’s still growing as Travel Tuesday — this year falling on Dec. 3 — gains traction.
snippet: Our Frugal Traveler columnist waded through the sales, and found some of the best bargains she’s seen in years.

headline: Does the United States Have an Infertility Crisis?
abstract: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has pledged to investigate the issue. Here’s what we know — and what we don’t — about infertility in America.
lead_paragraph: It’s become a popular talking point among some of President-elect Trump’s most prominent supporters: America has an infertility problem.
snippet: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has pledged to investigate the issue. Here’s what we know — and what we don’t — about infertility in America.

headline: Modern Warfare Is Breeding Deadly Superbugs. Why?
abstract: Researchers are trying to understand why resistant pathogens are so prevalent in the war-torn nations of the Middle East.
lead_paragraph: Last October, Christina Assi, a 28-year-old photojournalist for Agence France-Presse, took a selfie against the sunset and WhatsApped it to her mother. “Be careful,” her mother replied.
snippet: Researchers are trying to understand why resistant pathogens are so prevalent in the war-torn nations of the Middle East.

headline: Moths Were Destroying My Clothes. Tiny Parasitic Wasps Saved Them.
abstract: A “weird city version” of common countryside wisdom saved my favorite outfits.
lead_paragraph: Everything in life is a trade-off between money and time; when it comes to collecting vintage fashion, I put in the time. Catalogs from brands like Dries van Noten, Narciso Rodriguez and Prada, heavy as bibles, guide my search for cheap grails. I’ve often had the feeling that I’m rescuing these items from living with someone who wouldn’t appreciate them. Do they even care that Rodriguez finished his seams so elegantly that you can wear his dresses inside out? This level of care makes me feel calm in a careless world. During the pandemic, the brightly clashing florals of Van Noten’s 2008 Spring-Summer collection captured my heart — and bit by bit, via eBay and Etsy, my closet became a lush and jumbled garden. I’m not much of a nature person, but these were the sorts of pandemic plants I could tend to.
snippet: A “weird city version” of common countryside wisdom saved my favorite outfits.

headline: Review: ‘We Are Your Robots,’ Still Tuning Up
abstract: In Ethan Lipton’s musings on A.I., Mozart has a place alongside humpback whales.
lead_paragraph: Are they not men? The members of the onstage combo in Ethan Lipton’s new show are, in fact, robots, despite looking like middle-aged male representatives of the human species. They may play tunes for the benefit of the audience members, but their main purpose, Lipton informs us, is to find out “what you want from your machines, so we can make your lives better.” (Lipton narrates the show and performs lead vocals.) The purpose of the evening, it appears, is for these sophisticated high-tech creatures in gray suits to undergo deep learning.
snippet: In Ethan Lipton’s musings on A.I., Mozart has a place alongside humpback whales.

headline: Transforming Daniel Craig Into a Very Grimy William Burroughs
abstract: The clothes in Luca Guadagnino’s new film “Queer” are almost entirely from the 1950s. So don’t expect them to look spotless.
lead_paragraph: “Queer,” the director Luca Guadagnino’s new film, is a tale of misplaced affection. It is also a movie that will leave neat freaks clutching their Tide pens.
snippet: The clothes in Luca Guadagnino’s new film “Queer” are almost entirely from the 1950s. So don’t expect them to look spotless.

headline: The Best Way to Eat Thanksgiving Leftovers? Sauced and Tucked Into a Tortilla
abstract: Give that day-old turkey new life, and turn it into tender pavo al pastor or a hearty birria.
lead_paragraph: There are many reluctant turkey eaters out there. Deeming it bland or boring or both, they might begrudgingly eat it out of tradition or politeness. But when leftovers are being passed out at the end of the night, they’re nowhere to be found.
snippet: Give that day-old turkey new life, and turn it into tender pavo al pastor or a hearty birria.

headline: I Ran Operation Warp Speed. I’m Concerned About Bird Flu.
abstract: Avian influenza might mutate to enable human-to-human transmission.
lead_paragraph: As Donald Trump gets ready to return to the White House on Jan. 20, he must be prepared to tackle one issue immediately: the possibility that the spreading avian flu might mutate to enable human-to-human transmission.
snippet: Avian influenza might mutate to enable human-to-human transmission.

headline: Is Creativity Dead?
abstract: Or is the algorithm just hiding it from you?
lead_paragraph: As you scroll through the internet, you’ve probably noticed the same problem Kirby Ferguson has: “Everything looks the same, sounds the same, is the same.” In the Opinion Video above, the filmmaker argues that our culture often appears to be plagued by a dearth of creativity. But what if, beneath the surface of mainstream culture, there was a world of wild imagination waiting to be discovered — if only a powerful force would stop suppressing it?
snippet: Or is the algorithm just hiding it from you?

headline: Nicholas Kristof: Consider Skipping Meat This Thanksgiving
abstract: The columnist points out the hypocrisy of loving your dog while eating bacon.
lead_paragraph: It’s Thanksgiving week, and the columnist Nicholas Kristof wants you to consider skipping the turkey. “I don’t want to wag my fingers at people and tell them, ‘Look, this is how you should eat,’ but I do think that there are really important ethical questions that we have to ponder and confront,” he says. In this episode, Kristof argues that Americans, who spend thousands of dollars each year caring for their dogs, should spare a thought for the pigs who live short lives in brutal conditions before ending up on breakfast plates.
snippet: The columnist points out the hypocrisy of loving your dog while eating bacon.

headline: Breaking Up Google Would Be a Big Mistake
abstract: Such a move would help no one.
lead_paragraph: There’s no question that Google dominates the world of internet search. But in attempting to open up this critical industry to more competition, the government is pursuing a cure worse than the disease. If the government is successful at breaking up Google, history tells us that consumers and many enterprises tied to our vast and flourishing internet may ultimately pay a price.
snippet: Such a move would help no one.

headline: Would Bernie Have Won?
abstract: Faiz Shakir makes a case for the Democratic Party to embrace economic populism.
lead_paragraph: As the Democratic Party debates where to go after its 2024 drubbing, we’re going to spend the next two episodes of the show featuring two very different perspectives on the way forward.
snippet: Faiz Shakir makes a case for the Democratic Party to embrace economic populism.

headline: Our Mount Rushmore of Fictional Presidents
abstract: Jed Bartlett and other presidents of our youth.
lead_paragraph: After a “stranger than fiction” presidential race, the hosts take a deep dive into the messy movie and television plots that actually put this election to shame.
snippet: Jed Bartlett and other presidents of our youth.

headline: FIFA President’s Bet on Club World Cup Meets Reality
abstract: Gianni Infantino has tied his legacy to the 32-team tournament, even inscribing his name on the trophy. Its success is far from guaranteed.
lead_paragraph: Next summer, the United States will play host to an event that may define the legacy of FIFA’s president, Gianni Infantino.
snippet: Gianni Infantino has tied his legacy to the 32-team tournament, even inscribing his name on the trophy. Its success is far from guaranteed.

headline: Biden Cuts Intel’s Chip Award by More Than $600 Million
abstract: The Silicon Valley company will receive less money from the CHIPS Act after winning a $3 billion military contract and changing some of its investment commitments.

headline: Obesity Drugs Would Be Covered by Medicare and Medicaid Under Biden Proposal
abstract: The proposed rule could give millions of Americans access to the new drugs; it will also put pressure on the incoming Trump administration.
lead_paragraph: The Biden administration, in one of its last major policy directives, proposed on Tuesday that Medicare and Medicaid cover obesity medications, a costly and probably popular move that the Trump administration would need to endorse to become official.
snippet: The proposed rule could give millions of Americans access to the new drugs; it will also put pressure on the incoming Trump administration.

headline: Fentanyl Rises Again, This Time as Trump’s Diplomatic Weapon Against China
abstract: The president-elect’s pledge to use tariffs to stem the flow of opioids from China could backfire if Beijing responds by ending counternarcotics cooperation.
lead_paragraph: At the heart of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s threat on Monday to slap China with new tariffs is a bitterly recurring issue: the flow into the United States of the potent opioid fentanyl, created using chemicals made in China.
snippet: The president-elect’s pledge to use tariffs to stem the flow of opioids from China could backfire if Beijing responds by ending counternarcotics cooperation.

headline: After Trump’s Tariff Threat, Is a China Currency War Next?
abstract: While China could offset American tariffs by letting its currency fall, that might endanger Beijing’s recent efforts to stabilize the economy.
lead_paragraph: Beijing has a powerful tool for responding to President-elect Donald J. Trump’s threatened new tariffs on Chinese goods: It could start a currency war, a step that poses formidable risks for China as well as the United States.
snippet: While China could offset American tariffs by letting its currency fall, that might endanger Beijing’s recent efforts to stabilize the economy.

headline: Fury Unfolds in Pakistan
abstract: Scenes from the violent clashes between the security forces and protesters who are demanding the release of Imran Khan from prison.
lead_paragraph: Through Imran Khan’s evolution from global sports star to anti-corruption crusader and to prime minister of Pakistan — and then to outsider after his ouster in 2022 — his ability to mobilize huge street protests through social media has been a potent tool to pressure his opponents.
snippet: Scenes from the violent clashes between the security forces and protesters who are demanding the release of Imran Khan from prison.

headline: 4 Found Dead and 7 Still Missing After Tourist Ship Sinks in Egypt
abstract: The vessel was hit by a large wave in a part of the Red Sea coast that is known for diving and snorkeling.
lead_paragraph: Rescuers found five survivors and four bodies on Tuesday from the wreck of a boat carrying tourists that sank amid high waves off the Red Sea coast of Egypt a day earlier, according to the Egyptian authorities. Search efforts were continuing for seven other missing passengers and crew, they said.
snippet: The vessel was hit by a large wave in a part of the Red Sea coast that is known for diving and snorkeling.

abstract: The dollar gained and investors sold off stocks after the president-elect promised to levy new restrictions on the United States’ biggest trade partners.

abstract: Among other things, the retailer will no longer use the term D.E.I.

snippet: Among other things, the retailer will no longer use the term D.E.I.

headline: Has Social Media Advice Affected Your Finances? We Want to Hear From You.
abstract: If you have come across misleading personal finance advice online, tell us. We may include your experiences in an article.
lead_paragraph: Social media and other platforms have helped make information on financial literacy, investing and trading more accessible than ever. Many accounts share information that can help people manage their money. But others are sharing advice that regulators say can be misleading.
snippet: If you have come across misleading personal finance advice online, tell us. We may include your experiences in an article.

headline: New Drug Causes 20 Percent Weight Loss in Early Amgen Results
abstract: The drug, which is named MariTide and delivered in a monthly injection, is some time away from being sold.
lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical manufacturer Amgen announced on Tuesday that an experimental obesity drug helped patients lose up to 20 percent of their weight in a year. The drug, MariTide, is given by injection once a month, compared with once a week for other obesity drugs like Wegovy and Zepbound that are already on the market.
snippet: The drug, which is named MariTide and delivered in a monthly injection, is some time away from being sold.

headline: Mexico’s President Raises Prospect of Retaliatory Tariffs on U.S. Goods
abstract: President Claudia Sheinbaum responded to President-elect Trump’s threat to impose high tariffs, saying such a move would inflict damage on both countries.
lead_paragraph: Mexico’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, hit back on Tuesday morning at President-elect Trump’s vow to impose 25 percent tariffs on all products coming into the United States from Mexico, signaling that her country was prepared to respond with retaliatory tariffs of its own.
snippet: President Claudia Sheinbaum responded to President-elect Trump’s threat to impose high tariffs, saying such a move would inflict damage on both countries.

headline: The Rebellious Beauty of Nollywood’s Screen Sirens
abstract: The distinctive makeup of early-aughts Nigerian movies is coming back — and so is the daring attitude of the women who wore it.
lead_paragraph: In the early 2000s, the femme fatales of Nollywood were seldom seen without pencil-thin eyebrows, a thick, dark swipe of lip liner or a carefully placed, painted-on beauty mark. In Nigerian films like “Games Women Play” (2005), “Yankee Girls” (2008), “Mama, I Will Die for You” (2004) and “Love & Marriage” (2004), the rebellious city girls, wayward wives and conniving mothers-in-law are quickly identifiable by their flashy makeup, which often remixed early-aughts American trends. Although these movies have been popular among West African and diasporic viewers since their releases, their circulation over the years was relatively narrow, restricted to VHS, DVD and niche corners of YouTube. But now, nearly two decades later, a broader audience is discovering these films online and recreating their distinctive beauty looks for themselves — turning the “bad girls” of Nollywood’s recent past into their own modern heroes.
snippet: The distinctive makeup of early-aughts Nigerian movies is coming back — and so is the daring attitude of the women who wore it.

headline: Thanksgiving Eve Means Meatballs
abstract: Specifically, Kay Chun’s 5-ingredient, 20-minute pork and ricotta meatballs that call out for your favorite marinara and a pile of rigatoni.
lead_paragraph: When I was a kid, the night before Thanksgiving was for meatballs — a huge pot of them in burbling marinara sauce, with spaghetti alongside. (One year my brother’s golden retriever managed to knock at least four pounds of meatballs in sauce off the counter and went to town on them, but that’s another story.) Retriever incidents aside, I’m still a believer in meatballs as a cozy but festive way to feed a group: Everyone loves a meatball, and they are pretty easy both to make and to plan a menu around.
snippet: Specifically, Kay Chun’s 5-ingredient, 20-minute pork and ricotta meatballs that call out for your favorite marinara and a pile of rigatoni.

headline: Breyten Breytenbach, Anti-Apartheid Writer in Exile, Dies at 85
abstract: He wrote poetry in Afrikaans and prose in English in his fight against South African racial oppression, an effort that landed him in jail for seven years.
lead_paragraph: Breyten Breytenbach, a dissident South African-born poet, memoirist and former political prisoner who was jailed on trumped-up charges for anti-apartheid actions in the 1970s, died on Sunday in Paris, his longtime place of residence as an expatriate critic of his homeland. He was 85.
snippet: He wrote poetry in Afrikaans and prose in English in his fight against South African racial oppression, an effort that landed him in jail for seven years.

headline: North Carolina’s Democratic Governor Vetoes a G.O.P. Power Grab
abstract: Republicans have a supermajority in the state’s legislature and may move to override Gov. Roy Cooper’s veto, which would set off a new fight over state power and hurricane aid.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Roy Cooper of North Carolina, a Democrat, on Tuesday vetoed a bill passed by the state’s Republican-controlled legislature that would strip his office of important powers and shift more authority to G.O.P. officials.
snippet: Republicans have a supermajority in the state’s legislature and may move to override Gov. Roy Cooper’s veto, which would set off a new fight over state power and hurricane aid.

headline: One Housing Project Got Built. Another Didn’t. Why?
abstract: There’s a solution to New York City’s housing shortage: Build more homes. But that can get complicated. Mihir Zaveri, a New York Times reporter covering housing in the New York City region, explains why one project got built and another did not.
lead_paragraph: There’s a solution to New York City’s housing shortage: Build more homes. But that can get complicated. Mihir Zaveri, a New York Times reporter covering housing in the New York City region, explains why one project got built and another did not.
snippet: There’s a solution to New York City’s housing shortage: Build more homes. But that can get complicated. Mihir Zaveri, a New York Times reporter covering housing in the New York City region, explains why one project got built and another did not.

headline: Drake Accuses Universal Music of Boosting a Kendrick Lamar Song
abstract: The Canadian rapper filed legal papers on Monday in New York and Texas accusing his record label of promoting “Not Like Us” ahead of Drake’s tracks.
lead_paragraph: Drake’s war of words with Kendrick Lamar, through a vicious back-and-forth of diss tracks, generated some of the biggest headlines in rap this year.
snippet: The Canadian rapper filed legal papers on Monday in New York and Texas accusing his record label of promoting “Not Like Us” ahead of Drake’s tracks.

headline: Colman Domingo Makes Sense of ‘The Madness’
abstract: The Netflix thriller uses a murder mystery to explore the dangers of misinformation and conspiracy theories. “It’s this flood of not knowing what to believe,” the actor says.
lead_paragraph: The actor Colman Domingo had recently finished back-to-back shoots for the films “Rustin” and “The Color Purple.” He was not looking to star in a series, let alone a series in which the main character seemingly never stops talking. “I’ll be very honest,” he said. “I was trying to rest.” But when his agent sent him the scripts for “The Madness,” he couldn’t help himself.
snippet: The Netflix thriller uses a murder mystery to explore the dangers of misinformation and conspiracy theories. “It’s this flood of not knowing what to believe,” the actor says.

headline: Students and Teachers Share Advice for Having Conversations Across Divides
abstract: Over a thousand students and dozens of educators offered ideas for how to have meaningful discussions about difficult topics. Here are some practical ideas — for use in or out of school.
lead_paragraph: This fall, as part of our Election 2024 Student Conversation Challenge, we asked young people, How often do you have meaningful conversations with people who don’t share your views?
snippet: Over a thousand students and dozens of educators offered ideas for how to have meaningful discussions about difficult topics. Here are some practical ideas — for use in or out of school.

headline: Trump’s Tariffs Would Deal a Big Blow to the Auto Industry
abstract: Automakers and parts suppliers would struggle if President-elect Donald J. Trump followed through on his threat to impose 25 percent tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s threat to impose 25 percent tariffs on goods from Mexico and Canada sent shivers on Tuesday through the auto industry, which depends heavily on both countries for parts and manufacturing.
snippet: Automakers and parts suppliers would struggle if President-elect Donald J. Trump followed through on his threat to impose 25 percent tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico.

headline: Officials May Close Huge N.Y.C. Migrant Shelter, Fearing Trump Crackdown
abstract: The administration of Mayor Eric Adams is fearful that President-elect Donald J. Trump may target a Brooklyn tent complex housing 2,000 asylum seekers on federal land.
lead_paragraph: New York City officials are drawing up plans to shutter a giant Brooklyn migrant shelter amid concerns that the facility will attract the unwanted attention of the Trump administration.
snippet: The administration of Mayor Eric Adams is fearful that President-elect Donald J. Trump may target a Brooklyn tent complex housing 2,000 asylum seekers on federal land.

headline: Blue Blossom Puts a Modern Spin on Regional Chinese Dishes
abstract: Le Basque takes on vegan cooking, the Armani restaurant moves into the store’s flagship and more restaurant news.
lead_paragraph: You’ll find typical blue and white porcelain on the tables, as tiles and in a mosaic on the walls, at the latest spot from the executive chef Wang Lin Qun and his wife, the dim sum chef Fang Fang. They own and run the esteemed CheLi in the East Village, where Shanghai and the Song dynasty are the focus. Now their inspiration is broader, touching down all over China. Modern takes on tradition include cheese Xiao Long Bao, and a mingling of fish maw, abalone, sea cucumber and beef tendon in a seafood bisque fragrant with saffron. It’s also one few Chinese restaurants in New York serving potatoes: shredded and sautéed as prepared in Beijing, and mashed with pork sauce. The dining room, seating 200, includes a mezzanine.
snippet: Le Basque takes on vegan cooking, the Armani restaurant moves into the store’s flagship and more restaurant news.

headline: Starbucks Among Companies Affected by Ransomware Attack
abstract: Blue Yonder, which provides supply chain management software for thousands of companies, said a cyberattack had disrupted some services.
lead_paragraph: A ransomware attack against a supply chain manager has snarled payroll and scheduling services for prominent international companies, including Starbucks and one of Britain’s largest grocery store chains.
snippet: Blue Yonder, which provides supply chain management software for thousands of companies, said a cyberattack had disrupted some services.

headline: Are All These U.N. Climate Talks Doing Any Good?
abstract: What the U.N. negotiations, known as COP, can (and can’t) do to combat climate change.
lead_paragraph: When this year’s United Nations climate summit in Baku, Azerbaijan, ended on Sunday, most developing countries and climate activists left dissatisfied.
snippet: What the U.N. negotiations, known as COP, can (and can’t) do to combat climate change.

headline: Intense Israeli Airstrikes Send People Fleeing Beirut in Panic
abstract: The attack struck in the heart of the Lebanese capital after a series of evacuation warnings — the first for the city center during the war.
lead_paragraph: The first Israeli airstrike that rattled Beirut, the Lebanese capital, on Tuesday struck without warning, destroying a four-story building in the heart of the city. Then a barrage of airstrikes struck the city’s southern suburbs in quick succession: One strike, then two, then 20 — all within minutes and all sending plumes of black smoke across the skyline.
snippet: The attack struck in the heart of the Lebanese capital after a series of evacuation warnings — the first for the city center during the war.

snippet: Readers discuss the special counsel’s move and whether the cases should have been dismissed. Also: Medicaid; turkeys’ misery; skilled immigrants.

headline: These Aren’t Regular Mashed Potatoes. They’re Martha Stewart’s Mashed Potatoes.
abstract: To serve alongside Dolly Parton’s cranberry jelly tower and Christina Tosi’s one-pot corn bake.
lead_paragraph: Stars: They’re just like us. They love a club sandwich. They have strong opinions on pumpkin pie. And they get their mom’s mashed potatoes recipe and play with it a bit to make it better suit their tastes.
snippet: To serve alongside Dolly Parton’s cranberry jelly tower and Christina Tosi’s one-pot corn bake.

headline: Yes, It ‘Looks Like a Duck,’ but Carriers Like the New Mail Truck
abstract: The electric trucks have a side cargo door, more space and, critically, air-conditioning, promising some long-overdue relief for carriers, who haven’t had an upgrade since the 1980s.
lead_paragraph: For 19 years, Richard Burton, a letter carrier in Athens, Ga., drove the classic boxy mail truck, with only a fan on the dashboard to keep the cabin cool in the sweltering summer months. A second fan plugged into the cigarette lighter didn’t make much of a difference, he said.
snippet: The electric trucks have a side cargo door, more space and, critically, air-conditioning, promising some long-overdue relief for carriers, who haven’t had an upgrade since the 1980s.

lead_paragraph: Federal authorities, as part of a corruption investigation, are examining a New York City pastor and a political action committee he formed to support Mayor Eric Adams’s agenda, according to people with knowledge of the inquiry.

abstract: Soldiers have been ordered to defend government buildings and use gunfire against Imran Khan’s supporters if needed.
lead_paragraph: Soldiers have been ordered to defend government buildings and use gunfire against Imran Khan’s supporters if needed.

headline: These Wolves Like a Little Treat: Flower Nectar
abstract: After Ethiopian wolves feed on their favorite rodents, they may be enjoying a bit of dessert and in the process helping pollinate plants known as torch lilies.
lead_paragraph: The Ethiopian wolf, Africa’s most endangered predator, has a sweet tooth.
snippet: After Ethiopian wolves feed on their favorite rodents, they may be enjoying a bit of dessert and in the process helping pollinate plants known as torch lilies.

headline: Digging Into Kendrick Lamar’s Samples
abstract: Listen to some of the most notable sonic references on “GNX,” from SWV, Luther Vandross and Debbie Deb.
lead_paragraph: On Friday, the rap superstar Kendrick Lamar surprised everyone by releasing his sixth studio album, “GNX,” without warning. It is a fitting finale to a triumphant year for Lamar, who emerged victorious by just about every measure from a high-profile beef with hip-hop’s pre-eminent hitmaker Drake and scored one of the biggest smashes of his career with the caustic diss track, “Not Like Us.” The Compton rapper’s victory lap will continue into new year, too: On Feb. 2, he’s up for seven Grammys. A week later, he is set to headline the Super Bowl halftime show.
snippet: Listen to some of the most notable sonic references on “GNX,” from SWV, Luther Vandross and Debbie Deb.

headline: Fed Kept Options Open on Rate Cuts, Minutes Show
abstract: Minutes from a Nov. 6-7 meeting showed that Federal Reserve policymakers favored lowering rates “gradually.”
lead_paragraph: Minutes from the Federal Reserve’s November meeting offered little signal about whether officials would cut interest rates at their next gathering, though they suggested that policymakers did expect to continue to lower borrowing costs “gradually” over time.
snippet: Minutes from a Nov. 6-7 meeting showed that Federal Reserve policymakers favored lowering rates “gradually.”

headline: TV on the Radio, Brooklyn Rock Veterans, Return to the Stage
abstract: The acclaimed band, which emerged during the 2000s indie boom, is performing a series of live shows commemorating the 20th anniversary of its debut album.
lead_paragraph: Some members of an art scene, once it has become the subject of myth, make a habit of downplaying its reputed virtues, usually for reasons of mercy, modesty, or self-preservation. But the turn-of-the-century Brooklyn rockers TV on the Radio won’t sugarcoat it: Things really were better back then.
snippet: The acclaimed band, which emerged during the 2000s indie boom, is performing a series of live shows commemorating the 20th anniversary of its debut album.

headline: G.O.P. Senator Blocking Promotion of General Who Commanded Afghan Withdrawal
abstract: Lt. Gen. Christopher T. Donahue was recently selected to lead the U.S. Army’s Europe Command as the war in Ukraine heads into its fourth year.
lead_paragraph: A Republican senator is blocking the promotion of Lt. Gen. Christopher T. Donahue, the commander of U.S. troops in the final days of the withdrawal from Afghanistan, in what could be the first salvo in a Trump administration war against America’s generals.
snippet: Lt. Gen. Christopher T. Donahue was recently selected to lead the U.S. Army’s Europe Command as the war in Ukraine heads into its fourth year.

headline: Trump’s Tariff Plan Makes Little Sense
abstract: Why set off a tit-for-tat with our closest allies?
lead_paragraph: It seems perverse that Donald Trump would single out Canada and Mexico, two of the United States’ closest allies, for higher tariffs. But on Monday, he said that on his first day in office he would impose 25 percent tariffs on imports from the two countries that would remain in place until illegal drugs and migrants stopped coming over the borders.
snippet: Why set off a tit-for-tat with our closest allies?

headline: The Senate Should Leave No Judgeship Unfilled
abstract: Donald Trump will try to fill every judgeship that Democrats leave open.
lead_paragraph: In July the Supreme Court gave presidents immunity from criminal prosecution for their official actions, but that does not mean those actions are always lawful or constitutional. In the coming months and years, virtually all of the most extreme plans that Donald Trump has announced — using the military to deport immigrants, politicizing the Justice Department to go after his perceived enemies, refusing to spend money that has been appropriated by Congress, among many others — will be challenged in the federal courts. As happened during Mr. Trump’s first term, many of those plans are likely to be struck down by fair-minded judges and appeals courts if they exceed the president’s powers.
snippet: Donald Trump will try to fill every judgeship that Democrats leave open.

headline: Independent Inquiry Blames Israeli Leaders for Oct. 7 Failures
abstract: After the Israeli government delayed a formal investigation into the Hamas attacks, an alliance of survivors and victims’ families set up their own inquiry. Their scathing findings were released on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: For more than a year, the Israeli government has avoided holding itself to account for its failure to prevent the deadliest event in Israel’s history: the Hamas-led raid on Oct. 7, 2023.
snippet: After the Israeli government delayed a formal investigation into the Hamas attacks, an alliance of survivors and victims’ families set up their own inquiry. Their scathing findings were released on Tuesday.

headline: Blinken and U.S. Allies Struggle with Wars as Biden’s Presidency Wanes
abstract: Top diplomats from the Group of 7 nations tried to project unity on Ukraine while discussing differences over Israel and anticipating the return of Donald J. Trump.
lead_paragraph: The array of issues that top diplomats from the United States and allied nations tried to tackle in Rome over two days this week was dizzying: embattled Ukraine, multiple Middle East conflicts, the Sudan civil war and other hostilities in Africa, instability in Haiti and Venezuela, and tensions arising from military actions by China and North Korea.
snippet: Top diplomats from the Group of 7 nations tried to project unity on Ukraine while discussing differences over Israel and anticipating the return of Donald J. Trump.

headline: The Migrant Caravans Trump Derides Rarely Make It Close to the U.S.
abstract: Migrants often gather in groups in southern Mexico as a means of protection from criminal groups. But they almost never make it anywhere near the U.S.-Mexico border.
lead_paragraph: When President-elect Donald J. Trump vowed to impose new 25 percent tariffs on all goods coming into the country from Canada and Mexico, he said he’d keep them in place until drugs and people were stopped from crossing U.S. borders.
snippet: Migrants often gather in groups in southern Mexico as a means of protection from criminal groups. But they almost never make it anywhere near the U.S.-Mexico border.

headline: Tariff Threats Show Trump’s Commitment to Upending Global Trade
abstract: The president-elect’s threat to hit Canada, Mexico and China with new tariffs is already rocking business and diplomatic relationships and could topple the trade pacts he signed in his first term.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s threats to impose damaging tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China may ultimately be an opening wager to try to use the power of the American market to persuade other countries to stem a flow of drugs and migrants across U.S. borders.
snippet: The president-elect’s threat to hit Canada, Mexico and China with new tariffs is already rocking business and diplomatic relationships and could topple the trade pacts he signed in his first term.

headline: How to Host a Festive Fall Meal Like an Off-Duty Chef
abstract: Lauren Schofield — and her friends Anthony Ha and Sadie Mae Burns, of the restaurant Ha’s Đặc Biệt — take entertaining as seriously as their day jobs.
lead_paragraph: The holidays are a busy season for most, but for those who work in food and wine, it’s crunchtime. “We aren’t going to parties so much as we’re catering them,” says Lauren Schofield, 32, a Brooklyn-based pastry chef who makes desserts for events including weddings. And so in early November, she and her friends Anthony Ha, 32, and Sadie Mae Burns, 29, decided to co-host an autumnal afternoon feast for their industry comrades before everyone’s schedules filled up. The weather was still warm enough to take advantage of Schofield’s backyard in Brooklyn’s Crown Heights neighborhood, and Ha and Burns, the husband-and-wife duo behind Ha’s Đặc Biệt, a Vietnamese American pop-up restaurant, were preparing to launch their first permanent space, scheduled to open on the Lower East Side next month.
snippet: Lauren Schofield — and her friends Anthony Ha and Sadie Mae Burns, of the restaurant Ha’s Đặc Biệt — take entertaining as seriously as their day jobs.

headline: Saudi Arabia and Russia to U.N.: Don’t Talk About a Fossil Fuel Exit
abstract: A handful of oil-producing nations ensured that a United Nations General Assembly resolution on climate change steered clear of a call to transition away from fossil fuels.
lead_paragraph: Five dry words — “transitioning away from fossil fuels” — led to a bitter diplomatic spat Tuesday.
snippet: A handful of oil-producing nations ensured that a United Nations General Assembly resolution on climate change steered clear of a call to transition away from fossil fuels.

headline: ‘Vanderpump Rules’ Will Return With New Cast for Its 12th Season
abstract: The Bravo reality show is getting an entirely new cast for its 12th season. Lisa Vanderpump, for whom the show is named, will continue at its helm.
lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, the staff members at the West Hollywood restaurant SUR have defined a corner of the Bravo reality show universe in “Vanderpump Rules,” which has followed their cheating scandals, workplace drama and … did we say cheating scandals?
snippet: The Bravo reality show is getting an entirely new cast for its 12th season. Lisa Vanderpump, for whom the show is named, will continue at its helm.

headline: Wednesday Briefing: Israel Approves Hezbollah Cease-Fire Deal
abstract: Plus, Mexico reacts to Trump’s tariff threats.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s cabinet yesterday approved a cease-fire deal that would suspend fighting between Israel and the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah after more than a year of conflict.
snippet: Plus, Mexico reacts to Trump’s tariff threats.

headline: Biden Hopes to Parlay Lebanon Cease-Fire Into a Broader Regional Peace
abstract: With a deal to end more than a year of fighting between Israel and Hezbollah, the president turns his attention back to stopping the war in Gaza before leaving office.
lead_paragraph: Finally, President Biden got his Rose Garden peace deal. It was not exactly the one he has been straining to land for most of the past year, but it was a breakthrough nonetheless — and, coming after a bitter election, a sweet moment of validation.
snippet: With a deal to end more than a year of fighting between Israel and Hezbollah, the president turns his attention back to stopping the war in Gaza before leaving office.

headline: Rudy Giuliani Loses His Lawyers, and His Cool, in Court
abstract: The subject of several cases, the former New York City mayor lashed out at a judge questioning why he had not forfeited personal assets as required.
lead_paragraph: Rudolph W. Giuliani was not having a good day, and it showed.
snippet: The subject of several cases, the former New York City mayor lashed out at a judge questioning why he had not forfeited personal assets as required.

headline: Judge Approves Settlement That Changes Rules for Real Estate Agents
abstract: Following a lawsuit, the National Association of Realtors was ordered to rewrite its rules governing agents’ commissions and pay $418 million in damages.
lead_paragraph: It’s official: A legal settlement that will rewrite the way many real estate agents are paid in the United States has received its final approval from a federal judge.
snippet: Following a lawsuit, the National Association of Realtors was ordered to rewrite its rules governing agents’ commissions and pay $418 million in damages.

headline: He Helped ‘Break’ the Bank of England. Now He May Run the U.S. Treasury.
abstract: Scott Bessent’s former colleagues and rivals see the prospective Treasury secretary as a thoughtful choice with a broad understanding of financial markets.
lead_paragraph: Three decades before he was tapped to lead the Treasury Department, Scott Bessent was asked to help break another country’s financial system.
snippet: Scott Bessent’s former colleagues and rivals see the prospective Treasury secretary as a thoughtful choice with a broad understanding of financial markets.

headline: Why Is Trump Identifying the U.S.-Canada Border as a Problem?
abstract: Arrests for illegal crossings from Canada spiked in the last fiscal year, but remain a fraction of the number of those from Mexico.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald Trump’s ire toward Mexico for the flow of migrants into the U.S. is nothing new. Now, he has added Canada as a target over the issue.
snippet: Arrests for illegal crossings from Canada spiked in the last fiscal year, but remain a fraction of the number of those from Mexico.

headline: After Beloved Pilot Dies in Crash, 2 Rescue Dogs Rescue Themselves
abstract: Seuk Kim was transporting three rescue dogs from Maryland to Albany, N.Y., when his plane crashed in the Catskill Mountains. Two of the dogs managed to survive.
lead_paragraph: When a pilot on an animal-rescue mission died in a plane crash in upstate New York, a dog he was transporting also died, officials said. But two others survived, including one that was found in a snowy hole he had dug with broken legs.
snippet: Seuk Kim was transporting three rescue dogs from Maryland to Albany, N.Y., when his plane crashed in the Catskill Mountains. Two of the dogs managed to survive.

headline: Runners Use Secret Ingredient to Win N.C.A.A. Race: Olive Oil
abstract: B.Y.U.’s cross-country runners went old school and coated their bodies for a cold race day.
lead_paragraph: Brigham Young University was ready for the N.C.A.A. Division I cross-country championships on Saturday. It had strong men’s and women’s teams that had each won the Big 12 championship.
snippet: B.Y.U.’s cross-country runners went old school and coated their bodies for a cold race day.

headline: What the Cease-Fire Between Israel and Lebanon Means for Gaza
abstract: Can a truce lead to an enduring peace?
lead_paragraph: As it turns out, it’s possible to make peace in the Middle East as well as war: President Biden has announced that Israel and Lebanon have agreed to a cease-fire, and Israel’s cabinet members have approved the plan. A truce seems tantalizingly close.
snippet: Can a truce lead to an enduring peace?

headline: Israel Approves Cease-Fire With Hezbollah to Halt War in Lebanon
abstract: President Biden said the 60-day truce, which the United States helped broker, would take effect early Wednesday, and was intended to become permanent, ending Lebanon’s deadliest war in decades.
lead_paragraph: The Israeli security cabinet on Tuesday night approved a deal for a cease-fire with Hezbollah in Lebanon, signaling that more than a year of conflict will soon be suspended, and raising hopes around the region that Lebanon’s deadliest war in decades could be over.
snippet: President Biden said the 60-day truce, which the United States helped broker, would take effect early Wednesday, and was intended to become permanent, ending Lebanon’s deadliest war in decades.

headline: Fugitive on List of F.B.I.’s Most-Wanted Terrorists Is Captured in U.K.
abstract: The suspect, an animal-rights activist, was sought in connection to the bombings of two San Francisco-area businesses in 2003.
lead_paragraph: An animal-rights activist suspected in bombings at two locations in Northern California over two decades ago — and who landed on the F.B.I.’s list of most-wanted terrorists — was caught in Wales on Monday, the F.B.I. said on Tuesday.
snippet: The suspect, an animal-rights activist, was sought in connection to the bombings of two San Francisco-area businesses in 2003.

headline: Israel Approved Terms for a Cease-Fire With Hezbollah
abstract: Also, Mexico responded to Trump’s tariff threat. Here's the latest at the end of Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: Israel’s security cabinet voted this evening to approve a cease-fire agreement that would halt fighting in the yearlong conflict between Israeli forces and Hezbollah, the Lebanese armed group. The agreement, which still needs formal approval in Lebanon, is supposed to take effect at 4 a.m. local time tomorrow, said President Biden, who pushed Israel to agree to the deal.
snippet: Also, Mexico responded to Trump’s tariff threat. Here's the latest at the end of Tuesday.

headline: A Vulnerable Trudeau Hopes to Muster Unity Against Trump Tariff Plans
abstract: Many of the prime minister’s political opponents were as critical of him as about the president-elect’s plan, which would adversely affect Canada’s economy.
lead_paragraph: Amid rapidly growing anxiety over the potential harms to Canada if President-elect Donald J. Trump fulfills his promise to impose heavy tariffs on the country, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Tuesday that he would seek a united political front at an emergency meeting the following day with all of his country’s provincial and territorial leaders.
snippet: Many of the prime minister’s political opponents were as critical of him as about the president-elect’s plan, which would adversely affect Canada’s economy.

headline: Biden Announces Cease-Fire Deal Between Israel and Lebanon
abstract: The fighting has displaced over a million Lebanese and tens of thousands of Israelis, killed more than 3,000 Lebanese and 100 Israelis.
lead_paragraph: The fighting has displaced over a million Lebanese and tens of thousands of Israelis, killed more than 3,000 Lebanese and 100 Israelis.
snippet: The fighting has displaced over a million Lebanese and tens of thousands of Israelis, killed more than 3,000 Lebanese and 100 Israelis.

headline: Jack Smith Closes Up Shop, Defeated More by Voters Than by Jurors
abstract: The special counsel will leave behind a complex legacy, having amassed considerable evidence against Donald J. Trump but having lost key legal battles that could constrain future investigators.
lead_paragraph: Jack Smith arrived in Washington almost two years ago with expectations that his assignment to investigate Donald J. Trump would be profoundly consequential. But instead of leaving his post on the heels of a courtroom victory, he is departing after a defeat determined largely at the ballot box.
snippet: The special counsel will leave behind a complex legacy, having amassed considerable evidence against Donald J. Trump but having lost key legal battles that could constrain future investigators.

headline: Are the French Laundry and Per Se Still Worth a Splurge? We Went Back to See.
abstract: As Thomas Keller’s most influential restaurants hit major birthdays, the cost and the demand have risen. But what about the food and the fun?
lead_paragraph: From the earliest days of the French Laundry, you knew to expect a very fine meal as soon as you walked through its signature blue door. What you didn’t see coming were the jokes.
snippet: As Thomas Keller’s most influential restaurants hit major birthdays, the cost and the demand have risen. But what about the food and the fun?

headline: Trump Team Signs Transition Agreement but Shuns F.B.I. Clearances
abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s team will have some formal briefings with outgoing staff members, but it has so far refused to allow the F.B.I. to do security clearances for transition members.
lead_paragraph: Follow the latest updates on President-elect Trump’s transition.
snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s team will have some formal briefings with outgoing staff members, but it has so far refused to allow the F.B.I. to do security clearances for transition members.

headline: Trump’s Tariff Threat Pits Canada Against Mexico
abstract: The president-elect’s opening salvo in trade and border talks with the United States’ neighbors is casting a harsh light on the North American alliance.
lead_paragraph: Follow the latest updates on President-elect Trump’s transition.
snippet: The president-elect’s opening salvo in trade and border talks with the United States’ neighbors is casting a harsh light on the North American alliance.
